result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan T Rodeghier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:37 Defendant Ryan T Rodeghier in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dismissed and read-in to 15CF298.
from Attorney Kryshak with letters in support of defendant
State's Notice of Intent to Use videotaped Statements at Trial Pursuant to Section 908.08, Wis Stats

10:08 Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Chelsie Thuecks appears on behalf of co-defendant, Kyle Howlett.
Attorney Kryshak joins in co-defendant's motion for severance and motion in limine.
Attorney Grode states he has no objection to motions in limine.
Court grants as motions in limine.
Attorney Grode states he has no objection to motion to sever cases 15CF298 & 15CF299. Rodeghier's case 15CF298 will be tried first.
Court grants motion to sever.
Attorney Thuecks has filed a motion for bill of particulars. She wishes State to be more specific as to violation date. Attorney Kryshak joins in that motion and both attorneys make statements.
Attorney Grode opposes motion and makes statement.
Court denies motion.
Attorney Kryshak makes motion to modify Ryan Rodeghier's bond so defendant can attend youth group at his church.
Court will not rule on motion at this time until more information is gathered.
to Remand Proceedings to Juvenile Court
Cover Letter from Atty. Gary J. Kryshak, dated Dec. 30, 2015.

Defendant Ryan T Rodeghier in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle M Howlett in court with Attorney Chelsie A Thuecks.  Defendant Anthony C Christmas in court with Attorney Emily Nolan Plutchak.  The state motions to dismiss case 15CF250, against Anthony Christmas.  Court grants the dismissal of case 15CF250 against Anthonly Christmas.  Atty. Kryshak and Atty. Thuecks wishes to waive preliminary hearing on each of their cases.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 09-11-2015 11:30 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 9:11 Defendant Ryan T Rodeghier in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bound over for preliminary hearing. Waives time limits. Bond is continued.
